Notes.Text:
This update for sudo fixes the following issues:

Security issue fixed:

- CVE-2019-18634: Fixed a buffer overflow in the passphrase prompt that could occur when pwfeedback was enabled in /etc/sudoers (bsc#1162202).

Non-security issue fixed:

- Fixed an issue where sudo -l would ask for a password even though `listpw` was set to `never` (bsc#1162675).
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: In Sudo before 1.8.26, if pwfeedback is enabled in /etc/sudoers, users can trigger a stack-based buffer overflow in the privileged sudo process. (pwfeedback is a default setting in Linux Mint and elementary OS; however, it is NOT the default for upstream and many other packages, and would exist only if enabled by an administrator.) The attacker needs to deliver a long string to the stdin of getln() in tgetpass.c.
